commands.name: configure-decks
commands.title: Configure Anki Decks
commands.description: Configure deck mappings for Anki card creation

tools.name: get-deck-configurations
tools.title: Get Deck Configurations
tools.description: Retrieve all configured Anki decks with their note types, card templates, and format examples. MUST be called before add-card.

tools.name: add-card
tools.title: Add Card to Anki
tools.description: Add a new card to Anki using a configured deck ID. The card will use the deck's pre-configured note type and should follow the deck's template guidelines.

ai.instructions:
When the user wants to add a card to Anki:

1. ALWAYS call get-deck-configurations FIRST to retrieve:
   - Available deck IDs, names, and purposes
   - Note type for each deck (Basic or Basic (and reversed card))
   - Front and back card templates (formatting guidelines)
   - Front and back card examples

2. Select the appropriate deck ID based on:
   - The user's content
   - The deck's stated purpose

3. Format the Front and Back fields according to:
   - The deck's front template and back template (use these as formatting guidelines)
   - The deck's front example and back example (use these as reference)

4. Call add-card with:
   - The selected deck ID
   - The formatted Front field
   - The formatted Back field
   - Optional tags if applicable

5. The note type is pre-configured per deck and will be applied automatically
6. The confirmation will be shown automatically before creating the card

scripts.prepublishOnly:
echo "

It seems like you are trying to publish the Raycast extension to npm.

If you did intend to publish it to npm, remove the \`prepublishOnly\` script and rerun \`npm publish\` again.
If you wanted to publish it to the Raycast Store instead, use \`npm run publish\` instead.

" && exit 1
